comments:
When attempting to open the Execution Statistics view, I receive an error in the view pane.  The details of the error indicate that a NoSuchMethodError is being thrown.

I'm running Eclipse 3.2.2.  The TPTP Platform version is 4.2.4

Here is the full stack trace from the error.

Reverting back to the 4.2.2 TPTP version allows the Execution Statistics view to open again.

After checking further, I think I know what the problem is.  I used the Calisto update site to update my TPTP plugins.  The Calisto site has a version 4.2.4.  However, there doesn't appear to have ever been a 4.2.4 release.  The most recent Eclipse 3.2.2 release is 4.3.0.

It looks like the Calisto update site needs to be updated with the correct version.

Could you confirm again the version that is failing? There is no TPTP 4.2.4 release.

Could you also give more information on how to reproduce the problem? I cannot reproduce the problem with TPTP 4.3.0 which is the subsequent release of TPTP 4.2.2.
I am going to try get TPTP from Callisto update site and try again.
I still don't see the problem with Eclipse 3.2.2 and installing TPTP using Callisto update site.

What version of TPTP do you see on the Callisto Update Site?
The versions that I see for the TPTP Platform Project is 4.2.4.  TPTP Testing Tools show 4.2.4.  There is no 4.3 version for any of the TPTP features.

Created an attachment (id=78201)
update manager

you are right, some of the features under Test and Performance are tagged 4.2.x. I am not sure how that version is tagged. Joel, do you have any information regarding this?

Created an attachment (id=78202)
screen capture of updates

If I look at 'Software Update' > 'Find and Install...', and look at new feature of TPTP, I see the the correct list of TPTP releases in the Updates dialog.

The first screen shot from the Callisto update site contains all the features with the corresponding versions for a specific release. The numbers you see there are the version numbers of the features and not of a release. In this case, it is TPTP 4.2.2. If you look at the features listed in the TPTP update site from the second screenshot and expand a release you will notice that for one release each feature does not have the same version. For example, on the TPTP update site for TPTP release 4.2.2 the feature TPTP Platform Project has a version of 4.2.4.v200701141614. The third digit corresponds to bug fixes for the feature.
Thanks Joel, In that case, I was using 4.2.2 for my test, as shown in Comment #7.

After completely removing TPTP features and their dependencies, I reinstalled from the Callisto site.  Execution Statistics view is working correctly now.  I must have had an incompatibility issue somewhere in one of the plugins.

Issue is resolved as far as I am concerned.
